title: Property Graph Exchange Format (PG)
text: The Property Graph Exchange Format (PG) provides a data model, serialization formats and applications for labeled property graphs. See the PG specification for details.

title: Property Graph Exchange Format (PG)
text:
Example
# Nodes
alice :person name:"Alice" age:34
bob   :person name:"Bob"   age:32
luna  :dog                 age:4

# Edges
alice -- bob :friends since:2020
alice -> luna :owns





flowchart LR
    alice["<b>alice</b><br/><u>person</u><br/><i>name: Alice</i><br/><i>age: 34</i>"]
    bob["<b>bob</b><br/><u>person</u><br/><i>name: Bob</i><br/><i>age: 32</i>"]
    luna["<b>luna</b><br/><u>dog</u><br/><i>age: 4</i>"]
    alice -- "<u>friends</u><br/><i>since: 2020</i>" --- bob
    alice -- "<u>owns</u>" --> luna

title: Property Graph Exchange Format (PG)
text:
Applications

pg-formatter web application
pgraphs graph converter
syntax highlighting
blitzboard

title: Property Graph Exchange Format (PG)
text:
Publications

Chiba, H., Yamanaka, R., Matsumoto, S.: Property Graph Exchange Format. 2019
Chiba, H., Yamanaka, R., Matsumoto, S.: G2GML: Graph to Graph Mapping Language for Bridging RDF and Property Graphs. 2020
Voß, J.: Property-Graphen: eine kurze Einführung. 2024
